original_text:
**INSTITUTION
CRITICAL CARE MEDICINE
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN PROGRESS NOTE
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Jul 12 2007]
EVALUATION DATE :
**DATE[Jul 29 07]
I personally manage Mr. **NAME[AAA] in the ICU .
An **AGE[in 80s]- year - old man with a history of dementia , aspiration pneumonia , ARDS , and respiratory failure .
The patient continues with ARDS , respiratory failure with a chest x-ray which is compatible with ARDS .
He has not shown any substantial improvement .
He continues to also show poor cardiac perfusion and poor peripheral perfusion .
For the last two days , we have tried to optimize this as best we can and we have not been able to effectively make much difference .
He continues to be on high Fi02 and PEEP .
Ultimately we had a discussion with family and the family has decided to extubate the patient and make him comfortable with morphine .
There does not appear to be anything else reasonably that we can do at this point .
The patient is a comfort measures .
CRITICAL CARE TIME 30 MINUTES .
___________________________________
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , M.D.
Dictator :
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , M.D.
**INITIALS
D :
**DATE[Jul 29 2007] 19:54:24
T :
**DATE[Jul 30 2007] 00:36:28

CC:

-**NAME[XXX , VVV M]. ***
Electronically Signed by **NAME[WWW XXX]
**DATE[Aug 04 2007] 08:50:52 PM
